required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase 1, Open-Label Study of Teprotumumab in Patients With Diabetic Macular Edema (DME)
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 1, Open-Label Safety and Pharmacodynamic Study of RV001, an Insulin-Like Growth Factor-1 Receptor (IGF-1R) Antagonist, Administered by Intravenous (IV) Infusion in Patients With Center-Involved Diabetic Macular Edema (DME)

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: A Phase 1 Study to evaluate the Safety of teprotumumab in Patients with Diabetic Macular Edema.

detailed_description.textblock: A Phase 1, Open-Label Safety and Pharmacodynamic Study of RV 001, an Insulin-Like Growth Factor-1 Receptor (IGF-1) Antagonist, Given By IV Infusion in Patients with Center-Involved Diabetic Macular Edema (DME).

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Safety of RV001in subjects with Diabetic Macular Edema
primary_outcome.description: Number of subjects with adverse events, serious adverse events and early discontinuations due to adverse events. Number of subjects with clinical significant abnormal laboratory values, electrocardiograms (pre and post infusions), abnormal vital signs, ophthalmic and physical examinations.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of RV001in subjects with Diabetic Macular Edema
secondary_outcome.description: Pharmacodynamic measure includes change in Optical Coherence Tomography, Fluorescein Angiography and Stereoscopic color funds photos findings.

arm_group.description: Teprotumumab 20mg/kg administered by intravenous infusion every 3 weeks for 3 infusions

intervention.description: Teprotumumab 20mg/kg administered by intravenous infusion every 3 weeks for 3 infusions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of diabetes mellitus with Hemoglobin A1c <8%
- IGF 1 in serum > 145ng/mL
- Women of child-bearing potential must have negative pregnancy test and be willing and able to use two different methods of contraception, one of which must be oral contraceptive or depot formulation. Males must be surgically sterile or agree to use barrier contraception
- DME of less than 12 months with retinal thickening due to DME involving the center of the macula
- Non-proliferative diabetic retinopathy of moderate severity equivalent to Electronic Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) level 47 or below
- Best corrected electronic ETDRS letter score < 78 and > 24
- DME on Optical Coherence Tomography > 250 Î¼m
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unstable-uncontrolled diabetes as demonstrated by a change in diabetes medication greater than 15% in the previous 60 days.
- Significant renal disease, myocardial infarction, stroke, transient ischemic attack, acute congestive heart failure
- Blood pressure > 180/110
- Systemic anti-vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) treatment within four months prior to enrollment
- History of pan retinal photocoagulation within four months prior to enrollment
- History of ocular surgery within four months prior to enrollment
- History of systemic treatment with corticosteroids within 3 months prior to enrollment

overall_official.affiliation: Professor of Ophthalmology Duke Eye Center Duke University Medical Center
Retina Vitreous Associates Beverley Hills, California
